title: similar to P22 Jacobean Initials
content:
Hello,

I would love to use the font Jacobean Initials [http://www.p22.com/lanston/jacobeaninitials.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720062706/http:/www.p22.com/lanston/jacobeaninitials.html "http://www.p22.com/lanston/jacobeaninitials.html") however it does not include numbers.

Does anyone know of a similar typeface that includes numbers?

Thanks!

 [‹ Microsoft Silverlight Logo : A Trend or Laziness?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720062706/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39304 "Go to previous forum topic") [Type-1? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720062706/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39879 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mauphie

comments.content: [Lombardic Capitals](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720062706/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/lombardic_capitals/) and [Goudy Text Lombardic Caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720062706/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/monotype_goudy_text_lombardic_caps/) have a similar pedigree. They are without frame, though.
